The first Chinese-invested coal plant in Cambodia, the 405 MW CIIDG Erdos Hongjun plant has been operating since 2017. Built by subsidiaries of several central state-owned enterprises, the plant received financing from Bank of China. 3/ https://t.co/q0KaQRyHOv

Partly financed by Industrial and Commercial Bank of China, the plant has been developed by Cambodia’s CIIDG and Chinese state-owned Huadian. For more on the project, see our profile here. 2/ https://t.co/BqVEzq9YJX

This week, China Daily reported that Huadian’s Sihanoukville coal power plant commenced power generation after a 72-hour trial run. The 700MW plant is Cambodia's largest coal plant, and one of five with Chinese investment. 1/ https://t.co/tSqBrSao0k
